chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Ferguson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case Called: 2:21pm
INCLUDES 14CF785, 15CF353, and 15CM726
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner.  Deft appears in person with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
14CF785 in Ct. 3 to delete "use of dangerous weapon" enhancer
15CF353 in Ct. 1 to delete "repeater" enhancer
14CF785:
Ct. 1 Strangulation and Suffocation - repeater - domestic abuse >> D&RI
Ct. 2 Battery - repeater - domestic abuse >> D&RI
Ct. 4 Battery - repeater - domestic abuse >> D&RI
Ct. 6 Batter - repeater - domestic abuse >> D&RI
Ct. 7 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor - repeater >> D&RI
15CF353:
Ct. 2 Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 - repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor - repeater >> D&RI
15CM726:
Ct. 1 Battery - repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct - repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping - repeater >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
14CF785:
Ct. 3 Disorderly Conduct - repeater - domestic abuse >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 5 Disorderly Conduct - repeater - domestic abuse >> NO CONTEST
15CF353:
Ct. 1 Drive or operate vehicle w/o consent >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 3 years probation, concurrent. All probation and conditions to be transferred to Brown County. CONDITIONS: Complete mental health program in Brown County. Complete SAFE program or equivalent. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Complete any assessment, counseling, or treatment deemed necessary by agent. No controlled substances without valid perscription and take as required. Pay CC. Pay 2 domestic abuse surcharges. Pay DNA sample and surcharge only for 15CF353 Ct. 1. No contact with S.B. Zero days credit.
